================================================
In Feb/2015 Senator James M. Inhofe, Republican of Oklahoma, brandished a snowball on the Senate floor, suggesting that the ugly winter weather afflicting the Eastern Seaboard was evidence that global warming is a hoax. This moment of political theater was widely ridiculed (by Jon Stewart and others), but Ã¢â‚¬Å“Merchants of Doubt,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Robert KennerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s informative and infuriating new documentary, ought to remind us that the denial of climate change is hardly a joke.

And those who promote it Ã¢â‚¬â€ in the news media, in political discourse, in serious-looking reports published by dubious think tanks Ã¢â‚¬â€ are anything but fools. Ã¢â‚¬Å“Merchants of Doubt,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ based on Naomi Oreskes and Erik M. ConwayÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s book of the same title, examines the history of corporate-financed public relations efforts to sow confusion and skepticism about scientific research. The filmmakers interview scientists, activists and whistle-blowers who have tried to expose such activities, as well as some of its perpetrators, repentant and otherwise.
